header.title: Data visualization developer
header.bio: I'm a **journalist** who **codes** and **designs**. I currently do so as a data visualization developer at **Reuters Graphics**.

projects.name: Anatomy of a death threat

projects.name: A wave of voting laws
projects.description: An example of a quicker hit on deadline, I made use of our team tooling and customized our cartogram to fit the needs of this voting policy project. This one went up in less than a work week.

projects.name: When the right wing rallies
projects.description: This post analysis of the Jan. 6 Capitol riots uses animation and d3-force to visualize data from ACLED.

projects.name: Variant of concern
projects.description: Here I did the scroll step d3 maps you see, where you progress through multiple stages of the variants proliferating across the globe. One is of Great Britain, the other of the entire world. I created one Svelte component that is called twice and passed different props.

projects.name: High-risk dams
projects.description: A team effort, on this one I was the resident d3 developer and helped add the bar chart totals you see on the map that changes state up top. I also created the scrollytelling breakdown "Company Breakdown" section at the bottom.

projects.name: 500 Cities: A Look at Health and Geography
projects.description: Our Investigative teams took a look at the CDC's compiled dataset on various health in the U.S.'s 500 largest cities. I visualized disparities in urban areas for each of the cities included in the dataset that are in our markets. I created a clickthrough interactive that shows these disparities and is configured for each of our markets (try switching out "nbcnewyork.com" for "nbcchicago.com" in the URL.) Behind each interactive is a complex data workflow that joins shapefiles with CDC files and splits data by market. Lastly, I spent a good amount of time figuring out how to tween a scatterplot into a chloropleth map.

projects.name: Chicago's Municipal Election
projects.description: A huge part of my job is working with individual stations on local stories, so for Chicago's Feb. 26th election, I created a tool that looks up an address or place in Chicago and returns a ward number with candidate information.

projects.name: Diversity in the New Congress
projects.description: An intern and I dissected and analyzed the newly-elected congress as compared to the previous for a graphic on NBC's sites. I designed the layout for the congress arcs dynamically using d3 and the trusty formula for points along the circumference of a circle learned in high school trig.

projects.name: Live-Updating Midterm Election Maps
projects.description: My NBC Owned Television Stations team plans graphics for twelve individual markets' websites, and each one had their own API Key to receive election results from AP. To create twelve individual live-updating electurion results maps, I wrote an Amazon AWS Lambda script that scraped the results for all of our markets, parsed the data, and then deployed it to our server, where the data filled up twelve individual basemaps and updated at regular intervals.

projects.name: California Wildfires Becoming Year-Round Trend
projects.description: This project required me to pull acreage data on burning wildfires across the US from the USGS's FTP server. I used GDAL to convert shapefiles into csvs, and grouped acreage totals into days of the year in a Jupyter notebook. I then visualized daily totals using d3.

projects.name: The Great Pacific Garbage Patch, Visualized
projects.description: This project involved tracking down data from a scientific report on the Great Pacific Garbage patch and visualizing it, with the added feature of superimposing U.S. states over the patch to show its total size. It was a lot of mapping with GDAL, with the added bonus of hillshading from TIFF files.

projects.name: NRA's Independent Expenditures
projects.description: One of our national editors approached me asking how to visualize the strength of the NRA, and my response was to track data from Open Secrets on individual expenditures spent by the NRA on messaging for or against particular candidates.

projects.name: Searchable Chicago Primary Election Guide
projects.description: Ahead of the primary election, NBC Chicago asked me to create a widget that shows the user their elected representatives for their districts (based on an address they input), and which candidates had filed for the primary election. I created this widget, and then refreshed it for the general election in November.

projects.name: Educating Bay Area Teachers on Transgender Issues
Chicago Gun Prosecutions
projects.description: This project involved pulling data on gun violence incidents from the Gun Violence Archive and comparing that to the number of cases filed in various district courts under federal gun statutes to show that the Northern District of Illinois charged a disproportinately low number of federal gun charges relative to the amount of gun violence in the city of Chicago.
